name: Confetti Shrimp Cocktail Pasta Salad
description: A great warm weather salad reminiscent of Mexican shrimp cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 1 ripe avocado - peeled, pitted and chopped
1 pound cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined
½ cup finely chopped red onion
¼ cup chopped green bell pepper
¼ cup chopped red bell pepper
¼ cup chopped yellow bell pepper
¼ cup chopped orange bell pepper
1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; cook the pasta at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes; drain and rinse under cold water until chilled.
Place avocado into a bowl and sprinkle with 2 teaspoons lime juice to prevent browning; cover and refrigerate.
Toss cooked pasta, shrimp, tomatoes, green onions, red onion, green, red, yellow, and orange bell peppers, and cilantro in a large salad bowl until thoroughly combined.

Pour vegetable juice cocktail, olive oil, ketchup, and 1/4 cup lime juice into a food processor; add horseradish, jalapeno pepper, hot pepper sauce, salt, garlic, and black pepper. Pulse a few times to mix the dressing, then process until jalapeno and garlic are chopped very small, about 30 seconds. Pour dressing over pasta salad and stir to combine. Cover salad and chill thoroughly in refrigerator, 2 to 3 hours; just before serving, gently stir in avocado.

review.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this pasta salad. The cocktail sauce was a nice tasty difference from the traditional oil and vinegar or mayo type dressings. The only change I made was using the whole bell peppers since we like lots of veggies. My shrimp wasn't precooked so I sauteed it in some butter parsley with a little Old Bay and ground pepper for seasoning.

This is the first review I have ever written despite being on here for years.. just had to give a shout-out to this recipe because there was only 1 review and it really was great! Followed it exactly except I used penne b/c that's what I had on hand and no V-8 so used vegetable broth with a little tomato sauce mixed in. Next time I will double the shrimp and avocado since that was everyone's favorite part. Tastes better the next day!

Instead of the pasta I topped a spring salad with all of the salad ingredients. Also added some radishes and cucumber. The dressing was great (no changes) and could go on nearly any green salad. I would also use the dressing to marinade cooked shrimp for an hour or so instead of using cocktail sauce. I also think the dressing would also be perfect on a taco salad. Will definitely make again.
Healthy and delicious pasta salad. It is amazing how all of the flavors standout.
I love this! It is so refreshing and light. It's perfect if you love shrimp cocktail. I've also made a lower carb version and omitted the pasta and added more shrimp and avocado. Delicious!!!
I made this just as recipe called for We loved it. A real clean flavors. Will be making this more than my old mayo recipe. Thank You for a great recipe.

I had to sub a little, but hoped it made little changes to the original recipe. I used strained tomatoes with green chilies, reserving the juice with added tomato sauce ( adding  tomatoes to the shrimp mixture) for the tomato juice  cocktail and ketchup because I was out. Extra garlic, jalapeno and horseradish because we like heat..... I let it sit overnight without the pasta. Added the cooked pasta to half the salad about an hour before serving, topped with the avocado and fresh cilantro....it was fantastic!
OUTSTANDING!!! Its perfect in very way. I think it'll be great even without the shrimp just over some salad.

I love shrimp cocktail and I love this salad. I did make a number of changes (please don't boo and hiss.) because I was cooking for 1 person and you can't just have this many fresh ingredients on hand. I'm sure I would love the salad as written but I just can't have 4 kinds of peppers on hand and I can never manage to use up more than a fraction of the bunch of cilantro. So here's what I did. Only one change to the dressing - used mayo instead of olive oil. For the salad ingredients I used orzo pasta scallions red pepper iceberg lettuce shrimp and fresh sugar snaps. Cooked pasta for 6 minutes threw in the raw shrimp cooked 2 more minutes threw in the sugar snaps cooked 1 more minute. Cut up everything fairly small and tossed with the dressing. I believe the flavor profile of my version was the same as the submitter's (except for missing the cilantro). the small size of the pasta and the small chop on the veggies made a lot of surface area for the yummy dressing. Many thanks for a great recipe.
